title: After Test debacle, focus shifts to 2025 ICC Champions Trophy - The Times of India
India's long tour Down Under ends in early departure scramble - The Times of India
summary:
India's long tour Down Under ends in early departure scramble

Date: Sunday
Source: Times of India

The fifth Test between India and Australia concluded with the team now in a rush to secure flights home after nearly two months in Australia, having been initially set to depart on January 8.

  • The match ended earlier than expected, prompting players to scramble for tickets to return home.
  • Senior players are expected to leave as soon as tickets are available, leading to staggered departures.
  • The Indian team travelled over 7700 kilometers across Australia during the tour.
  • Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah faced challenges; Bumrah leading in wickets despite a recent back issue.
  • R Ashwin annouced his retirement from international cricket during the series.
“The logistics manager is working it out for the team and as and when the tickets are available, the departures will begin.”

The Indian cricket team faced both travel challenges and key player issues, wrapping up this tour with significant lessons and experiences.
newTitle: India's Tour of Australia Concludes Amid Ticket Scramble

title: 'Greatest ever', 'Defining moment of Cummins era': How Australian media celebrated the team's triumph ove - The Times of India
Cricket Australia ends silence after shocking Sunil Gavaskar snub for trophy presentation in Sydney - Hindustan Times
summary:
Cricket Australia Concedes Snub in Trophy Presentation

Date: Jan 06, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Cricket Australia faced backlash after not inviting former Indian captain Sunil Gavaskar to the trophy presentation for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney, which raised questions about their decision-making.

  • Sunil Gavaskar, while present at the ceremony, was ignored during the trophy presentation despite his pivotal role in the series history.
  • Allan Border presented the trophy to Pat Cummins after Australia triumphed, leaving Gavaskar standing isolated at the boundary ropes.
  • Cricket Australia later admitted it was a mistake to exclude Gavaskar from the stage, suggesting that both he and Border should have participated in the ceremony.
  • Gavaskar expressed disappointment, emphasizing the significance of both countries in the trophy's legacy.
“Just because I am an Indian (I did not present the trophy). I would have been happy to present the trophy with my good friend Allan Border.” - Sunil Gavaskar

This incident caused a stir on social media, showcasing the ongoing passion and rivalry between the cricketing nations of India and Australia.
newTitle: Cricket Australia Addresses Controversial Snub of Sunil Gavaskar in Trophy Presentation

title: 'Gautam Gambhir was getting all the credit': Former India cricketer's huge comment on Rohit Sharma's inte - The Times of India
summary:
Sanjay Manjrekar Comments on Rohit Sharma's Interview Regarding Gambhir's Influence

Publication Date: Sunday Source: Times of India

Former Indian batter Sanjay Manjrekar suggested that Rohit Sharma's interview during the fifth Test against Australia was influenced by Gautam Gambhir receiving credit for his exclusion from the squad.

  • Rohit Sharma opted out of the fifth Test in Sydney, leading to Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy.
  • India lost the series 1-3 after a six-wicket defeat in the SCG Test.
  • Manjrekar believes Rohit's interview was aimed at clarifying Gambhir's influence on his exclusion.
  • Rohit faced criticism for his poor performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, averaging only 6.20 runs across five innings.
“Somewhere I think Gambhir was getting all the credit for a brave call by leaving Rohit Sharma out.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

This commentary sheds light on the dynamics of team selection and the pressures faced by players in high-stakes environments.
newTitle: Sanjay Manjrekar Comments on Rohit Sharma's Interview Regarding Gambhir's Influence

title: Yograj Singh At It Again, Sends Loud Message To Gautam Gambhir Over Virat Kohli's Form - NDTV Sports
summary:
Yograj Singh At It Again, Sends Loud Message To Gautam Gambhir Over Virat Kohli's Form

Date: November 11, 2024

Source: NDTV

After India's disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, former cricketer Yograj Singh offered insights on Virat Kohli's lack of form, emphasizing the need for proper management instead of traditional coaching.

  • Kohli scored only 190 runs in five Tests, dismissed eight times for playing the wrong shots.
  • Singh argues that players need mental support and man-management rather than just technical coaching.
  • He highlights the importance of communication and understanding a player's struggles.
  • Singh critiques Gautam Gambhir's coaching style, advocating for better management alongside technical guidance.
  • The context of India's six-wicket loss in the Sydney Test, missing out on the World Test Championship final, emphasizes the urgency of these issues.
“When players are down, struggling to perform, management becomes that magic wand that lifts them up.” - Yograj Singh

In conclusion, Yograj Singh calls for a shift in how players, particularly stars like Kohli and Rohit, are supported during their challenging phases, stressing the intersection of performance and mental well-being.
newTitle: Yograj Singh Critiques Gautam Gambhir on Kohli's Performance

title: Reason Behind Rohit Sharma's Interview? Manjrekar Says "Gautam Gambhir Was Getting Credit For..." - NDTV Sports
summary:
Reason Behind Rohit Sharma's Interview? Manjrekar Says "Gautam Gambhir Was Getting Credit For..."

Publication Date: January 5, 2025, Source: NDTV

India captain Rohit Sharma's future as a Test cricketer is under scrutiny following his omission from the recent Test series against Australia. He addressed his situation in a recent interview.

  • Rohit was dropped from the Sydney Test, raising questions about his role in the team's future.
  • In an interview, he stated he is not retiring but opted out due to poor form.
  • Sanjay Manjrekar suggested the interview aimed to clarify his situation, noting Gautam Gambhir was receiving credit for his exclusion.
  • Manjrekar emphasized that players should respect the decisions made by the chairman of selectors regarding their future.
“Retirement is in your hands, but playing for India is not,” said Manjrekar.

The future of Rohit Sharma remains uncertain, and his recent statements may reflect a desire to reshape the narrative around his Test career.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Future as Test Cricketer Uncertain Amid Controversy

title: How Team India's decade of dominance ended against Australia - The Times of India
summary:
How Team India's Decade of Dominance Ended Against Australia

Date: SYDNEY
Source: Times of India

Australia crush India inside three days to bag the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, marking the end of India’s dominance in Test cricket over the last decade.

  • Australia won the series 1-3, regaining the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India's batting lineup was criticized for its inconsistency and lack of depth.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was over-reliant on due to injuries affecting the team's overall performance.
  • The team showed a lack of strategy and execution on the field leading to their defeat.
“No amount of white-ball bashing in docile conditions can erase the consequences of this series defeat.”

This series has raised questions about India's Test cricket future and their strategy moving forward, highlighting a need for leadership and innovation within the team.
newTitle: How Team India's Decade of Dominance Ended Against Australia

title: R Ashwin's Big Blunder On X, Deletes Message Sent To Rohit Sharma's 'Wife' - NDTV Sports
'We are white-ball bullies. If we beat Pakistan on Feb 23...': Harsh reality exposed on Ranji demand from Kohli, Rohit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Despite the uproar, Mohammad Kaif revealed why under-fire Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma could miss the Ranji Trophy

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In light of India's disappointing performance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, there have been strong calls for senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma to participate in the upcoming Ranji Trophy to regain form. However, former cricketer Mohammad Kaif suggests that fatigue and upcoming international commitments may prevent their participation.

  • Kohli and Rohit face criticism for their absence in domestic cricket.
  • India suffered a 1-3 series loss against Australia, marking a significant setback.
  • Kaif describes India as "white-ball bullies," emphasizing the need for a robust Test team.
  • Kohli's average in Test has dropped significantly since 2022, adding pressure for improvement.
"On 23rd February India will earn a lot of praise by beating Pakistan... but if India wants to win the World Test Championship then they will have to make a Test match team." - Mohammad Kaif

The current domestic hiatus for Kohli and Rohit has drawn a lot of attention and criticism, as both players need to adapt and prepare better for upcoming international challenges. Their involvement in the Ranji Trophy could be crucial for their development and the future of Indian Test cricket.
newTitle: Kohli and Rohit Might Miss Ranji Trophy Amid Calls for Domestic Participation

title: Jasprit Bumrah breaks silence on his back injury after winning Player-of-the-Series award: 'You can't fight your body' - Hindustan Times
‘Doping is a big problem in India’: Neeraj Chopra drops bombshell statement, claims ‘To tell you the truth…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Neeraj Chopra Addresses Doping Issues in Indian Sports

Date: Jan 06, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Neeraj Chopra, India's superstar javelin thrower, has made significant remarks regarding the doping epidemic in Indian athletics, emphasizing the need for a change in mindset among young athletes.

  • In 2022, India recorded the highest number of drug cheats globally, with 125 out of 3865 samples testing positive.
  • The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) listed India as the second worst country for doping cases among minors.
  • Chopra urged athletes to focus on hard work, proper guidance, and healthy practices rather than doping for performance enhancement.
  • A total of 142 Indian athletes were caught doping between April 2022 and March 2023.
“Once doping is in the mind, it gets hard in the future... the mindset of our athletes needs to be changed.” - Neeraj Chopra

Chopra advocates for a cultural shift in Indian sports, hoping to eradicate doping and improve overall performance standards.
newTitle: Neeraj Chopra Addresses Doping Issues in Indian Sports

title: ‘We are losing, losing, losing'’: Gavaskar tears into Gautam Gambhir, Morne Morkel; says ‘questions need to be asked’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar critiques head coach Gautam Gambhir after Border-Gavaskar Trophy loss

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Sunil Gavaskar has voiced concerns regarding the coaching decisions made by head coach Gautam Gambhir following India’s 1-3 defeat in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, questioning the effectiveness of the support staff and the strategies employed.

  • Gambhir's coaching team includes Abhishek Nayar and Ryan ten Doeschate as assistants, and Morne Morkel as bowling coach.
  • India has faced consecutive losses in ODIs and Tests under Gambhir’s coaching.
  • Gavaskar emphasized the need for accountability, specifically regarding batting and bowling strategies.
  • He criticized the lack of planning against key Australian players like Travis Head and Pat Cummins.
  • Gavaskar highlighted the importance of players participating in domestic cricket to improve their performance.
“What were they doing that we had this situation where we are losing, losing, losing?” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar’s remarks suggest a growing concern among fans and experts regarding India's cricket management and strategies moving forward.
newTitle: Gavaskar Critiques Gambhir's Coaching After India’s Series Loss

title: India's Fixtures In 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series In England, New Zealand; BGT At Home - News18
summary:
India's Fixtures in the 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series in England, New Zealand; BGT at Home

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

India will compete in the fourth edition of the World Test Championship (WTC) starting in 2025, hosting various teams and tackling significant away series.

  • India will face West Indies, South Africa, and Australia at home.
  • The team will travel to England, Sri Lanka, and New Zealand for away series.
  • India's first series in the new WTC cycle begins with a five-match Test series in England from June 20, 2025.
  • India's last series of this cycle will be against Australia at home in early 2027.
After a disappointing end to the 2023-25 WTC cycle, Team India is expected to see many changes before starting the new campaign in June.

India's roadmap for the WTC 2025-27 cycle sets the stage for exciting cricket, as they look to regain their footing after previous losses.
newTitle: India's Fixtures in the 2025-2027 World Test Championship: Away Series in England, New Zealand; BGT at Home

title: That's why Ruben Amorim needed to arrive six months ago! Winners & losers as Man Utd manager shows value of preparation with deserved Anfield draw to keep lacklustre Liverpool from running away with Premier League title race - Goal.com
summary:
Ruben Amorim's Strategic Preparation Leads to Impressive Draw Against Liverpool

Publication Date: N/A | Source: Goal

The Red Devils demonstrated resilience with a 2-2 draw against Liverpool, showcasing the importance of coach Ruben Amorim's preparations ahead of the match.

  • Manchester United earned a hard-fought 2-2 draw against Liverpool.
  • Lisandro Martinez scored to give United an early lead.
  • Despite losing the lead, Amad Diallo equalized for United.
  • United's performance raised questions about not hiring Amorim sooner.
  • Amorim had more time to prepare for this key match compared to previous games.
“Had Sir Jim Ratcliffe and his fellow executives been more ruthless and got the Portuguese on board for pre-season, then he would have had months to get his ideas across to his players rather than the smattering of sessions he has had to implement his methods.”

In conclusion, the match highlighted both the potential of United under Amorim and the missed opportunity of his earlier appointment.
newTitle: Ruben Amorim's Strategic Preparation Leads to Impressive Draw Against Liverpool

title: Vidya Balan's Team Reacts To PR Allegations After Posting In Favour Of Rohit Sharma: Not Avid Sports Fan But.. - Times Now
summary:
Vidya Balan's Team Reacts To PR Allegations After Posting In Favour Of Rohit Sharma: Not Avid Sports Fan But...

Date: January 4, 2024 Source: Times of India

Bollywood actress Vidya Balan expressed her admiration for Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma's decision to step down during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, but faced backlash and allegations of a publicity stunt.

  • Rohit Sharma's selfless decision sparked mixed reactions online.
  • Vidya Balan praised Sharma on social media, leading to accusations of insincerity.
  • Balan's team denied the allegations, affirming her genuine admiration.
“Let it be unequivocally stated that Ms. Balan posted this completely of her own volition ... to attribute her actions to anything other than a spontaneous reaction is completely preposterous,” said her team.

The incident highlights the scrutiny public figures face on social media and the immediate backlash that can follow their expressions of support.
newTitle: Vidya Balan's Team Responds to PR Allegations Following Support for Rohit Sharma

title: Harsh Goenka takes a dig at India’s failure to qualify for WTC 2025 after India lost BGT against Australia - Mint
summary:
Harsh Goenka takes a dig at India’s failure to qualify for WTC 2025 after India lost BGT against Australia

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Live Mint

With a disappointing performance, the Indian cricket team, led by Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah, failed to secure the Border Gavaskar Trophy (BGT) against Australia, leading to criticism from RPG Enterprises' Chairman Harsh Goenka.

In a match held at the Sydney Cricket Ground, India lost the series 1-3, ending a decade-long success in the BGT.

  • India lost the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after a six-wicket defeat by Australia.
  • The defeat ruined India's chances of qualifying for the World Test Championship 2025 finals.
  • Goenka commented on social media about the reliance on certain players.
  • His tweet gained significant attention, with over 17,000 views and multiple comments.

Aaj kuch ‘Sharma’ sa gaya hoon, baat bhi ‘Gambhir’ hai ki hum World Test Championship mein ‘Kohli-fy’ nahi kar paaye. Lagta hai hum apne ‘Bumrah’stra par kuch zyada hi depend karne lage hain. #INDvAUS

— Harsh Goenka (@hvgoenka) January 5, 2025

This situation has sparked a lot of debates among fans and analysts regarding the team's performance and strategy.
newTitle: Harsh Goenka Critiques India's BGT Loss and WTC Qualification Failure

summary:
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli's Next Assignment Confirmed, Will Play In...: Report

Date: February 2025

Source: Times Now

India's cricket stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli will participate in the ODI series against England starting February 6, despite past criticisms of their performances.

  • India recently lost a Test series against Australia 1-3.
  • Sharma and Kohli faced significant criticism during the Test series.
  • The three-match ODI series is crucial preparation for the Champions Trophy 2025.
  • Jasprit Bumrah is expected to be rested for the ODI series.
“Even captain Rohit Sharma acknowledged that Jasprit Bumrah has been overbowled and his workload needs to be managed.”

This ODI series marks an important step for India as they gear up for the upcoming Champions Trophy.

title: Agarawal's hot streak continues; Haryana, Punjab, Bengal and TN in knockouts - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Agarawal's Hot Streak Leads Karnataka to Knockouts in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: January 9, 2024 Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Mayank Agarawal continued his impressive form, scoring his fourth List A century as Karnataka secured a spot in the knockouts of the 2024-25 Vijay Hazare Trophy. Haryana, Punjab, Bengal, and Tamil Nadu also made it through, with notable performances across the teams.

  • Karnataka tops Group C with a one-wicket win over Punjab.
  • Mumbai, winners of the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, failed to reach the knockouts.
  • Punjab finished as the best second-ranked team thanks to standout performances by Prabhsimran Singh.
  • Gujarat and Vidarbha are the only teams with an all-win record in the group stage.
“His performance has been crucial for the team,” praised the commentator about Agarawal.

As the tournament progresses, the knockouts are scheduled to begin, showcasing the competitive spirit among the teams in the Vijay Hazare Trophy.
newTitle: Agarawal's Hot Streak Leads Karnataka to Knockouts in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Shan Masood and Babar Azam Set New Record for Pakistan Against South Africa

Published on: October 2023, Source: Times of India

In an impressive display of cricket, Shan Masood and Babar Azam have made history by registering a new record for Pakistan in their match against South Africa.

  • Masood scored a remarkable century, leading the team to a commanding position.
  • Babar Azam's partnership with Masood proved crucial in the match.

“This record is a testament to our hard work and dedication,” said Babar Azam after the match.

title: Pakistan Star Saim Ayub To Consult Specialist Doctor In This City After Ankle Injury, Eyes Champions.. - NDTV Sports
'Reset, avoid on-field battles': AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice - The Times of India
summary:
AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Following a challenging tour of Australia, AB de Villiers has shared critical advice with his friend Virat Kohli, who faced difficulties in his batting performance, particularly against deliveries outside off-stump, leading to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli struggled with his form in the recent series, scoring only 190 runs over nine innings.
  • His performance included an average of 23.75, with a single century in the first Test.
  • De Villiers highlighted the need for Kohli to reset his mindset and avoid on-field battles during tough times.
  • Kohli's significant challenges in the ongoing 2024-25 Test season were also discussed, where he has only managed 382 runs in 10 matches.
  • De Villiers acknowledged Kohli's fighting spirit but urged him to refocus after every ball.
“...it is best to get rid of those things. As a batter, it is to reset every single and realize every ball is an event and just forget about the bowler.” - AB de Villiers

In conclusion, AB de Villiers believes that a mental reset will be crucial for Kohli to regain his form and contribute effectively to the team.
newTitle: AB de Villiers advises Virat Kohli to reset his mindset after tough Australia tour
